=== Introduction ===
Welcome! This is the home for Mactel (Intel CPU-based Macintosh Computers) running Ubuntu. Here you'll find all the supported versions of Ubuntu for your Mac, whether it be a Macbook, Macbook Pro, iMac, Air, etc.
This page is primarily for (potential) users. If you would like to get started as a member of the Mactel Support Team, please go to the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MactelSupportTeam|Mactel Support Team Home]]</nowiki>. 

=== What Model Hardware do I Have? ===

To determine which version / generation / hardware revision your  Mac  is... <<BR>><<BR>>
<nowiki>[[File:OSX.png]]</nowiki> ...under OSX,
1. Click in OS X on the Apple on the top left
2. Click "About this Mac"
3. Click "More Info..."
4. Find the generation / version in the "Model Identifier" row.  

Alternatively, run in a terminal:
<pre>
sysctl hw.model
</pre>

<nowiki>[[File:Linux.png]]</nowiki> ...under Ubuntu,
Open a terminal by going to Applications -> Accessories -> Terminal, and type:
<pre>
sudo dmidecode -s system-product-name
</pre>

=== Mactel Community Documentation ===

Generic installation instructions for dual and triple booting can be found here: <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MactelSupportTeam/AppleIntelInstallation|Apple Intel Installation]]</nowiki>

There is some info regarding use of Apple Keyboards here: <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/AppleKeyboard | AppleKeyboard Wiki]]</nowiki>

The <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MactelSupportTeam/CommunityHelpPages#Mactel%20Wiki%20Support%20Matrix|support matrix]]</nowiki> lists our best supported and most recent help guides.  Guides for older version of Ubuntu can be found at the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MactelSupportTeam/CommunityHelpPages#Mactel%20Product%20Pages|product page]]</nowiki> for your Mac.

=== Additional Hints ===
* If you are working with a Virtual Machine (VMWare Fusion, Parallels, Virtual``Box, Qemu), try your VM's support area. Running Ubuntu in a VM is completely different than running Ubuntu "on your Mac". Feel free to ask your question in the forums, but much if not all of the support pages linked below will not apply to you. When posting in the forum, be sure to mention that you are using Ubuntu in a VM and what VM you are using! If you are not using a VM, continue to the next step.
* If you have a hardware revision of a Mac, that is new or unlisted, post your Mac version and the output of 'lspci' to the <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/forumdisplay.php?f=328|Apple Users Ubuntu Forums]]</nowiki>. In this way the support team can see what hardware you have. Try to use the wiki page for the latest version of your Mac. Note anything that works on your new hardware.
=== The support forum ===
If you like to ask a question or post a comment about Ubuntu on Macintosh hardware, use the <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/forumdisplay.php?f=328|Apple Users support forum]]</nowiki>
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <tablestyle="background-color: #f9eaaf;"><nowiki>[[File:info2.png]]</nowiki> '''Please note:'''<<BR>> - When posting please include your '''Mac hardware revision'''  in your post so that everybody knows, what hardware you are dealing with.<<BR>> - Additionally, when the solution is found, mark the thread solved.<<BR>> - Also, if you figure the problem out yourself, please post the solution so that others might benefit as well.
|}
